positions.title: The Haskell Company
positions.description: Successfully led 3D Coordination meetings on several projects. In addition, created several color-coded quantity takeoff sheets, Point-Cloud-based models and 4D simulation videos. Established workflows and standards for implementing sUAS and Virtual Reality applications within the company.

positions.title: BIM Coordinator
positions.description: Worked in developing and updating as-­built models of current projects in addition to running clash detection tests for new projects. Moreover, developed several conceptual designs and 3D renderings of potential projects for marketing purposes.

positions.title: Research Assistant
positions.description:
Performed extensive data analysis for construction related research. In addition, contributed to published papers about: augmented reality in construction, use of unmanned aerial vehicles in construction, cloud computing in construction and virtual reality and gaming engines in CM education. Moreover, assisting teacher for both graduates and undergraduates BIM classes. Lastly, coaching the UF Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) team to win a national championship (ASC regions 6 & 7 2014).

positions.title: Cost Engineer
positions.description: Responsibilities included keeping track of several large projects’ cash flow and expenditures and submitting early estimates of proposed projects and change orders of current projects. Conducted weekly site visits to compare quantities and quality of delivered materials and equipment.

positions.title: Construction Project Manager
positions.description:
Worked as an owner’s rep in charge of branch construction projects coordinating with several contractors. Main job was to ensure contractors delivered projects on time, within budget and with specified quality and standards. Conducted weekly site visits to generate progress reports and punch-item lists. Successfully completed and opened 2 brand new stand-alone and 3 rented-space branches (average of 16,000 SF each)
